page.title: 05RECTORY WOOD CHURCH STRETTON
page.content: Originally{Rectory Wood}was a pleasure ground belonging to the former Rectory before the County Council bought it in 1960. The folly was built by the Church Stretton Rector and taken over by the water board in the war. There are two grave stones which were from the old church and they are now bridges over the stream. There is quite a lot of{wildlife}in there and these are some of the animals that live there: foxes, squirrels, birds, moles, voles and weasles. The stream comes from the reservoir and has got fish like trout. There are many interesting trees including a Spanish Chestnut which is {300 years old.}The lime tree has got a spiral route going round it and you can climb quite high.
